subject: Investing
title: Narrative Fallacy: Stories That Mislead
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Narrative Fallacy: Stories That Mislead.

hook.text: After every market move, pundits explain exactly why it happened. Before the move, they had no idea.

buildup.text: The narrative fallacy is our need to construct causal stories to explain random events.

discovery.text: Markets often move on no news at all. But humans can't accept randomness, so we invent explanations.

twist.text: Compelling investment narrativesâ€”'AI will change everything'â€”can justify absurd valuations until they don't.

climax.text: Always check the numbers behind the narrative. Stories seduce; spreadsheets reveal.

punchline.text: A great story is not a great investment thesis. Demand the data.

quiz.question: What is the narrative fallacy?
options: Constructing causal stories to explain random events
